summary.purpose: Provides a comprehensive set of Popover components built on Radix UI's popover primitive, including root, trigger, content, and anchor components with built-in animations, styling, and optional arrow support.
summary.problem_solved: Simplifies creating accessible, animated popover menus and floating panels by wrapping Radix UI's Popover with pre-styled components, consistent Tailwind CSS styling, configurable positioning, and optional arrow indicators.

external.name: @radix-ui/react-popover
external.why_used: Provides accessible Popover primitive components (Root, Trigger, Content, Portal, Arrow, Anchor) with positioning and keyboard interaction

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core React library for component creation and ComponentProps type

internal.why_used: Provides the cn() utility function for conditionally merging CSS classes

symbols.name: Popover
symbols.description_one_line: Root popover component wrapping Radix UI's PopoverPrimitive.Root

details.what_it_does: Manages the popover's open/closed state and coordinates all child components (trigger, content, anchor). Wraps PopoverPrimitive.Root with a data-slot='popover' attribute for styling hooks. Passes all Radix Popover Root props through.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Missing Popover wrapper
incorrect.why_incorrect: All popover sub-components must be wrapped within a Popover root component. Without it, the state management and accessibility features won't function. The Popover root manages the open/closed state that all other components depend on.

symbols.name: PopoverTrigger
symbols.description_one_line: Button or element that toggles the popover open/closed when clicked

details.what_it_does: Wraps PopoverPrimitive.Trigger with a data-slot='popover-trigger' attribute. When clicked, toggles the associated popover's open/closed state. Can accept any child element via the asChild prop.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: PopoverTrigger outside Popover
incorrect.why_incorrect: PopoverTrigger must be inside a Popover root component to work. It relies on the Popover's state context to manage opening/closing.

symbols.name: PopoverContent
symbols.description_one_line: Floating content panel rendered in a portal with animations, positioning, and optional arrow

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default content styles

params.name: align
params.description: Horizontal alignment of the popover relative to the trigger. Defaults to 'center'.

params.name: sideOffset
params.description: Distance in pixels between the popover and the trigger element. Defaults to 4.

params.name: showArrow
params.description: Whether to display an arrow pointing to the trigger element. Defaults to false.

params.name: children
params.description: Content to render inside the popover panel

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Content props (side, avoidCollisions, etc.)

returns.description: A styled floating panel with animations and positioning

details.what_it_does: Renders the popover content in a portal outside the normal DOM tree. Pre-styled with a light background, foreground text color, rounded borders, padding, and shadow. Automatically positioned relative to the trigger with configurable alignment and offset. Includes fade-in/fade-out animations and slide animations based on the popover's side (top, bottom, left, right). Optionally displays an arrow pointing to the trigger.
details.rendered_ui_description: A floating panel with max-width 18rem (w-72), rounded borders (rounded-md), border color, background color, padding, and subtle shadow. Smoothly animates in when popover opens (fade-in, zoom-in, slide-in from appropriate side). Optional arrow indicator at the edge pointing to the trigger element.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: PopoverContent without trigger
incorrect.why_incorrect: PopoverContent needs a PopoverTrigger to position against. Without a trigger, there's no reference element for positioning the floating panel.

symbols.name: PopoverAnchor
symbols.description_one_line: Alternative anchor element for positioning the popover relative to

details.what_it_does: Wraps PopoverPrimitive.Anchor with a data-slot='popover-anchor' attribute. Provides an alternative positioning reference for the popover content. Can be used instead of or alongside PopoverTrigger to position the popover relative to a specific element.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Anchor as only positioning element
incorrect.code:
// Anchor alone may not provide expected interaction
<Popover>
  <PopoverAnchor>Anchor only</PopoverAnchor>
  <PopoverContent>Content</PopoverContent>
</Popover>
incorrect.why_incorrect: PopoverAnchor provides positioning but not interaction. Use PopoverTrigger to make the popover interactive, or use Anchor in combination with Trigger for more complex layouts.
